segment.documentation: BGM, A segment for unique identification of the declaration type, i.e. import, export, in-transit.
DTM, A segment to specify the dates, times or periods relevant to the whole message e.g. elected date of presentation, date of message.
LOC, A segment to identify a place or location relevant to the entire message e.g., office of entry, clearance port.
CNT, A segment specifying control totals e.g. total number of Express Consignments reported, total number of master transport documents, total number of packages.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to identify contact party details.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to specify the party name and address responsible for the express consignment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments indicating contact parties and contact numbers.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment identifying contact party.
COM, A segment identifying the contact party's telephone and/or fax number.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to identify details of transport, means of transport, references and associated locations, dates and times.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate the name of the carrier, name/number of vehicle or flight, conveyance reference number.
DTM, A segment to specify the dates, times or periods relevant to the transport used.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to provide details of locations, dates and times relevant to the means of transport.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify a place or location relevant to the transport details.
DTM, A segment to specify dates, times or periods relevant to the transport details e.g. actual date/time of arrival.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments giving details of equipment and seals.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to identify a unit of equipment.
SEL, A segment to specify a seal number related to equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments giving details of all consignments covered by an individual Master Transport Document reference.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify Master Transport Document references or similar documentation pertinent to the conveyance report.
NAD, A segment to specify the party name and address of the sender and receiver of the Master Transport Document.
CNT, A segment to specify control totals e.g. total number of House Transport Documents.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: SG13-SG14-SG15 A group of segments giving details of single express consignments at the House Transport Document level.

segment.documentation: CNI, A segment to indicate the reference number of the House Transport Document for the relevant consignment.
SGP, A segment to specify the placement of the goods in relation to equipment.
CNT, A segment specifying control totals e.g. total number of Customs items reported.
MEA, A segment providing for measurements requirements related to the express consignment e.g. gross weight.
LOC, A segment identifying place/location relevant to the express consignment, e.g. country of consignment, place of loading/unloading.
NAD, A segment describing name and address of the shipper and consignee of the express consignment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments giving information relevant to the nature of the cargo.

segment.documentation: GDS, A segment specifying the nature of the goods in accordance with the Customs Cooperation Council (CCC)/International Express Carriers Conference(IECC) Express Consignment Guidelines : i.e. Category 1 - Documents, Category 2 - Low-value non-dutiable goods, Category 3 - Low-value dutiable goods, Category 4 - High value goods.
FTX, A segment specifying the description in narrative form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments giving details of packages and markings.

segment.documentation: PAC, A segment to identify the number and type of packages.
PCI, A segment to identify markings and labels on the type of package reported.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to specify terms of delivery and related locations.

segment.documentation: TOD, A segment identifying terms and places of delivery of the entered goods e.g. coded International Rules for the Interpretation of Trade Terms (INCOTERMS).
LOC, A segment identifying the place/location relevant to the terms of delivery of the express consignment.
FTX, A segment describing terms of delivery in narrative form.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments to specify monetary amounts.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying the monetary amounts relative to the express consignment e.g. declared value of a single consignment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments to specify rates of exchange and currencies.

segment.documentation: CUX, A segment to specify rates of exchange/currencies reported in regard to value.
DTM, A segment to specify date and time relevant to exchange rates regarding the value of the express consignment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments giving the total of duties/taxes/fees and methods of payment related to the consignment.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment identifying the tax type, rate and base associated with the consignment.
MOA, A segment identifying monetary amounts (e.g. tax/fee amount) associated with the preceding TAX.
GEI, A segment identifying an indicator (e.g. method of payment indicator) associated with the preceding TAX.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments to specify documentary requirements and references related to the express consignment.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment specifying the documentation requirements for particular Customs/government agencies e.g. invoice, certificate of origin.
DTM, A segment specifying date/time/period information as related to the documentation requirements.
LOC, A segment identifying the place/location relevant to the documentation requirements.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments giving information relevant to the Customs treatment of the goods at Customs item level.

segment.documentation: CST, A segment describing the goods in terms of Customs entities, status and intended use i.e. the H.S. Tariff Codes.
FTX, A segment specifying the Customs description in narrative form.
LOC, A segment identifying place/location relevant to the Customs treatment of the goods e.g. country of origin.
MEA, A segment providing for measurements requirements related to the Customs item e.g. net weight and supplementary units.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments identifying duties/taxes/fees and methods of payment related to a Customs item.

segment.documentation: TAX, A segment identifying the tax type, rate and base associated with a Customs item.
MOA, A segment identifying monetary amounts (e.g. tax/fee amount) associated with the preceding TAX.
GEI, A segment identifying an indicator (e.g. method of payment indicator) associated with the preceding TAX.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments to specify authentication results.

segment.documentation: AUT, A segment that identifies and verifies the authenticity of the sender and data integrity.
DTM, A segment specifying date/time/period information related to the authentication requirements.
